cuidados-barba.title: Complete Guide: Beard Care
cuidados-barba.excerpt: Discover the secrets to keeping your beard always impeccable with tips from our specialist barbers.
cuidados-barba.content:
A well-groomed beard is synonymous with style and personality. In this guide, we'll share the secrets our barbers use to keep beards always impeccable.

## 1. Proper Washing

Wash your beard 2-3 times a week with a beard-specific shampoo. Regular hair products can dry out the hair and skin.

## 2. Hydration is Key

Use beard oil daily. It moisturizes the hair, reduces itching, and gives a healthy shine. Apply after showering when pores are open.

## 3. Regular Brushing

Brush your beard daily with a natural bristle brush. This distributes natural oils, removes dead cells, and trains the hair to grow in the right direction.

## 4. Regular Trimming

Even if you're growing it out, trim the ends every 2-3 weeks to remove split ends and maintain a defined shape.

## 5. Diet and Hydration

Drink plenty of water and maintain a diet rich in proteins, biotin, and vitamins. This directly reflects on hair health.

## Conclusion

Beard care is a ritual worth doing. With consistency and the right products, you'll have a beard that becomes your signature.

tendencias-cortes-2025.title: Men's Haircut Trends for 2025
tendencias-cortes-2025.excerpt: Discover the cuts dominating barbershops and how to choose the ideal one for you.
tendencias-cortes-2025.content:
2025 brings an interesting mix of reinvented classics and bold new styles. Check out the main trends:

## 1. Modern Mullet

The mullet is back strong, but in a more refined version. Shorter on the sides with smooth transitions, perfect for those who want to be bold without overdoing it.

## 2. Textured Buzz Cut

The shaved cut gained texture on top. Ideal for those seeking practicality without giving up style.

## 3. Mid Fade with Fringe

The combination of medium fade with textured fringe remains popular. Versatile and easy to style.

## 4. Classic American Cut

The traditional side part never goes out of style. In 2025, it comes with a more natural finish and less product.

## 5. Textured Crop

Short cut with lots of movement on top. Perfect for thick and wavy hair.

## How to Choose?

Consider your hair type, face shape, and lifestyle. When in doubt, talk to your barber - we're here to help!

## Conclusion

The most important trend is the one that suits you. Come visit us and let's find the perfect cut together.

corte-ideal-rosto.title: How to Choose the Ideal Cut for Your Face Shape
corte-ideal-rosto.excerpt: Learn to identify your face shape and discover which cuts enhance your features.
corte-ideal-rosto.content:
Choosing the right cut can completely transform your appearance. The secret is understanding your face shape.

## Identifying Your Shape

### Oval Face
Considered the most versatile shape. The forehead is slightly wider than the chin, with prominent cheekbones.
**Ideal cuts:** Almost all! Take advantage and experiment.

### Round Face
Length and width are similar, with full cheeks.
**Ideal cuts:** Cuts with volume on top and shorter sides elongate the face. Avoid very short cuts all around.

### Square Face
Strong, angular jaw, wide forehead.
**Ideal cuts:** Textured cuts that soften the angles. Medium fades work very well.

### Rectangular/Oblong Face
Face longer than wide.
**Ideal cuts:** Avoid too much volume on top. Sides with more length balance the proportions.

### Triangular Face
Chin wider than forehead.
**Ideal cuts:** Volume on top to balance. Fringes and fuller cuts on top.

## Extra Tip

Besides shape, consider:
- Hair texture
- Growth line
- Personal style
- Care routine

## Conclusion

There's no wrong cut, just cuts that don't match. Schedule an appointment and let's find yours together!

cuidados-pos-corte.title: Essential Post-Haircut Care
cuidados-pos-corte.excerpt: Learn how to keep your cut impeccable longer with these simple tips.
cuidados-pos-corte.content:
Left the barbershop with the perfect cut? Here's how to keep it that way longer:

## First 24 Hours

### Avoid Washing
Wait at least 24 hours before washing your hair. This allows natural oils to reestablish.

### Don't Touch Too Much
Resist the temptation to keep running your hands through it. Your fingers transfer oil.

## First Week

### Right Products
Use light products in the first days. Heavy pomades and waxes can overload freshly cut hair.

### Sleep Carefully
Use a silk or satin pillowcase to reduce friction and maintain shape.

## Ongoing Maintenance

### Washing
Wash your hair every 2-3 days with shampoo suitable for your hair type.

### Conditioner
Use conditioner only on the length, never on the roots.

### Drying
Dry with a towel without rubbing. Let it air dry when possible.

## When to Return?

To keep your cut always fresh:
- Short cuts: 2-3 weeks
- Medium cuts: 4-6 weeks
- Long cuts: 6-8 weeks

## Conclusion

Small care makes a big difference. And when you need a touch-up, we'll be here waiting!
